unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals are More Than Just Fancy Dress Ups
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals are More Than Just Fancy Dress Ups

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and movie maniacs! Ever wondered what happens outside those glitzy award shows you see on TV? Well, let's talk about film festivals! They're like the secret spice in the cinematic biryani, adding flavour and bringing together filmmakers and audiences in a way no regular movie theatre can.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and movie maniacs! Ever wondered what happens outside those glitzy award shows you see on T V? Well, let's talk about film festivals! They're like the secret spice in the cinematic biryani, adding flavour and bringing together filmmakers and audiences in a way no regular movie theatre can.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: You're tired of the same old masala films playing everywhere. You crave something different, something…real. That's where film festivals come in. They showcase independent films, documentaries, shorts, and experimental cinema that you wouldn't normally find at your local PVR.

unnormalised: I remember attending the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa a couple of years back. Total madness! So many films, so little time. I managed to catch a screening of a short film by a young director from FTII Pune – a brilliant piece about the struggles of a tea stall owner in Assam. It was raw, powerful, and completely captivating. That’s the magic of these festivals, unearthing hidden gems.

unnormalised: Beyond the films, festivals are a fantastic place to network. Picture this: You're sipping chai at a stall, chatting with a renowned cinematographer from Chennai, and then bumping into a director whose work you admire! It's all about making connections and building your community.

unnormalised: Of course, there's the glamour. Star sightings are common – you might just spot a Bollywood bigwig or two strutting down the red carpet. But at their core, film festivals are about celebrating the art of filmmaking, irrespective of budget or star power.

unnormalised: From the Mumbai Film Festival to the Kolkata International Film Festival, India has a thriving festival circuit. So next time you're looking for a cinematic adventure, ditch the usual suspects and check out a film festival near you. You might just discover your new favourite filmmaker or an unexpected gem that stays with you long after the credits roll. Plus, Goa’s always a good idea, right? I spent roughly Rs. 5,000 on food and travel and it was totally worth it. The distance from Panjim to the venue was approximately 10 km. Trust me, you won't regret it!
